trans-unit.source: Create a DocumentDB database collection | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a DocumentDB database collection | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create collections using the online service portal for Azure DocumentDB, a managed NoSQL document database for JSON.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create collections using the online service portal for Azure DocumentDB, a managed NoSQL document database for JSON.

trans-unit.source: Get a free trial today.
trans-unit.target: Get a free trial today.

trans-unit.source: Create a DocumentDB collection using the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Create a DocumentDB collection using the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: To use Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, you must have a [DocumentDB account](documentdb-create-account.md), a [database](documentdb-create-database.md), a collection, and documents.
trans-unit.target: To use Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, you must have a [DocumentDB account](documentdb-create-account.md), a [database](documentdb-create-database.md), a collection, and documents.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create a DocumentDB collection in the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create a DocumentDB collection in the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Collections do not have to be created using the preview portal, you can also create them using the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Collections do not have to be created using the preview portal, you can also create them using the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).

trans-unit.source: For a C# code sample showing how to create a collection using the DocumentDB .NET SDK, see the [Program.cs](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net/blob/master/samples/code-samples/CollectionManagement/Program.cs) file in the CollectionManagement project, available in the [azure-documentdb-net](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net) repository on [GitHub.com](https://github.com).
trans-unit.target: For a C# code sample showing how to create a collection using the DocumentDB .NET SDK, see the [Program.cs](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net/blob/master/samples/code-samples/CollectionManagement/Program.cs) file in the CollectionManagement project, available in the [azure-documentdb-net](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net) repository on [GitHub.com](https://github.com).

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/), click **Browse all**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/), click **Browse all**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Browse** blade, click **DocumentDB Accounts**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Browse** blade, click **DocumentDB Accounts**.

trans-unit.source: In the **DocumentDB Accounts** blade, select the account that contains the database in which to add a collection.
trans-unit.target: In the **DocumentDB Accounts** blade, select the account that contains the database in which to add a collection.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have any accounts listed, you'll need to [create a DocumentDB account](documentdb-create-account.md).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have any accounts listed, you'll need to [create a DocumentDB account](documentdb-create-account.md).

trans-unit.source: Screen shot highlighting the Browse button, DocumentDB Accounts on the Browse blade, and a DocumentDB account on the DocumentDB Accounts blade
trans-unit.target: Screen shot highlighting the Browse button, DocumentDB Accounts on the Browse blade, and a DocumentDB account on the DocumentDB Accounts blade

trans-unit.source: In the **Database** blade, click **Add collections**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Database** blade, click **Add collections**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add Collection** blade, enter the ID for your new collection.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add Collection** blade, enter the ID for your new collection.

trans-unit.source: When the name is validated, a green check mark appears in the ID box.
trans-unit.target: When the name is validated, a green check mark appears in the ID box.

trans-unit.source: Select a pricing tier for the new collection.
trans-unit.target: Select a pricing tier for the new collection.

trans-unit.source: Each collection you create is a billable entity.
trans-unit.target: Each collection you create is a billable entity.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the performance levels available, see [Performance levels in DocumentDB](documentdb-performance-levels.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the performance levels available, see [Performance levels in DocumentDB](documentdb-performance-levels.md).

trans-unit.source: Select one of the following **Indexing Policies**.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the following **Indexing Policies**.

trans-unit.source: **Default**.
trans-unit.target: **Default**.

trans-unit.source: This policy is best when you’re performing equality queries against strings and using ORDER BY, range, and equality queries for numbers.
trans-unit.target: This policy is best when you’re performing equality queries against strings and using ORDER BY, range, and equality queries for numbers.

trans-unit.source: This policy has a lower index storage overhead than **Range**.
trans-unit.target: This policy has a lower index storage overhead than **Range**.

trans-unit.source: **Hash**.
trans-unit.target: **Hash**.

trans-unit.source: This policy is best when you’re performing equality queries for both numbers and strings.
trans-unit.target: This policy is best when you’re performing equality queries for both numbers and strings.

trans-unit.source: This policy has the lowest index storage overhead.
trans-unit.target: This policy has the lowest index storage overhead.

trans-unit.source: **Range**.
trans-unit.target: **Range**.

trans-unit.source: This policy is best you’re using ORDER BY, range and equality queries on both numbers and strings.
trans-unit.target: This policy is best you’re using ORDER BY, range and equality queries on both numbers and strings.

trans-unit.source: This policy has a higher index storage overhead than **Default** or **Hash**.
trans-unit.target: This policy has a higher index storage overhead than **Default** or **Hash**.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the indexing policies, see [DocumentDB indexing policies](documentdb-indexing-policies.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the indexing policies, see [DocumentDB indexing policies](documentdb-indexing-policies.md).

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** at the bottom of the screen to create the new collection.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** at the bottom of the screen to create the new collection.

trans-unit.source: Screen shot highlighting the Add Collection button on the Database blade, the ID box on the Add Collection blade, and the OK button
trans-unit.target: Screen shot highlighting the Add Collection button on the Database blade, the ID box on the Add Collection blade, and the OK button

trans-unit.source: The new collection now appears in the **Collections** lens on the **Database** blade.
trans-unit.target: The new collection now appears in the **Collections** lens on the **Database** blade.

trans-unit.source: Screen shot of the new database in the DocumentDB Account blade
trans-unit.target: Screen shot of the new database in the DocumentDB Account blade

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a collection, the next step is to add documents or import documents into the collection.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a collection, the next step is to add documents or import documents into the collection.

trans-unit.source: When it comes to adding documents to a collection, you have a few choices:
trans-unit.target: When it comes to adding documents to a collection, you have a few choices:

trans-unit.source: You can [add documents](../documentdb-view-json-document-explorer.md) by using the Document Explorer in the preview portal.
trans-unit.target: You can [add documents](../documentdb-view-json-document-explorer.md) by using the Document Explorer in the preview portal.

trans-unit.source: You can [import documents and data](documentdb-import-data.md) by using the DocumentDB Data Migration Tool, which enables you to import JSON and CSV files, as well as data from SQL Server, MongoDB, Azure Table storage, and other DocumentDB collections.
trans-unit.target: You can [import documents and data](documentdb-import-data.md) by using the DocumentDB Data Migration Tool, which enables you to import JSON and CSV files, as well as data from SQL Server, MongoDB, Azure Table storage, and other DocumentDB collections.

trans-unit.source: Or you can add documents by using one of the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Or you can add documents by using one of the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB has .NET, Java, Python, Node.js, and JavaScript API SDKs.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB has .NET, Java, Python, Node.js, and JavaScript API SDKs.

trans-unit.source: The [Program.cs](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net/blob/master/samples/code-samples/DocumentManagement/Program.cs) file in the DocumentManagement project, available in the [azure-documentdb-net](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net) repository on [GitHub.com](https://github.com), demonstrates CRUD operations on documents by using the DocumentDB .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: The [Program.cs](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net/blob/master/samples/code-samples/DocumentManagement/Program.cs) file in the DocumentManagement project, available in the [azure-documentdb-net](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net) repository on [GitHub.com](https://github.com), demonstrates CRUD operations on documents by using the DocumentDB .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: After you have documents in a collection, you can use [DocumentDB SQL](documentdb-sql-query.md) to [execute queries](documentdb-sql-query.md#executing-queries) against your documents by using the [Query Explorer](documentdb-query-collections-query-explorer.md) in the preview portal, the [REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781481.aspx), or one of the [SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).
trans-unit.target: After you have documents in a collection, you can use [DocumentDB SQL](documentdb-sql-query.md) to [execute queries](documentdb-sql-query.md#executing-queries) against your documents by using the [Query Explorer](documentdb-query-collections-query-explorer.md) in the preview portal, the [REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781481.aspx), or one of the [SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
